meanings.definition: Halutzim: plural form of halutz, meaning a pioneer or settler in Israel.
meanings.sent1: The halutzim bravely traveled to new lands to build homes.
meanings.sent2: The halutzim were determined to create a better future for their families.
meanings.sent3: The halutzim joked that they were modern-day explorers seeking new horizons.
meanings.sent4: The halutzim were like seeds, planting themselves in unfamiliar soil to grow.
meanings.sent5: The image of the halutzim forging ahead into the unknown stayed with me.

meanings.definition: Halutzim: a group of halutzim working together to establish a new settlement.
meanings.sent1: A dedicated team of halutzim cleared the land for the village.
meanings.sent2: The halutzim collaborated seamlessly to construct houses and roads.
meanings.sent3: The halutzim playfully argued over who had the best building skills.
meanings.sent4: The halutzim were like a hive of bees, each with a vital role in the community.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the halutzim united in purpose was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: Halutzim: individuals who are actively involved in the development of a community or society.
meanings.sent1: The halutzim organized events to improve the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Community meetings were always well-attended by the halutzim.
meanings.sent3: The halutzim were known for their creative solutions to common problems.
meanings.sent4: The halutzim were the engines driving progress in the town.
meanings.sent5: The dedication of the halutzim shone brightly in every project they undertook.
